newsitem.title: USA: American Airlines pilots elect new leader.
newsitem.headline: American Airlines pilots elect new leader.

text.p: Pilots for AMR Corp's American Airlines on Thursday elected Dallas-based pilot Rich LaVoy to head the Allied Pilots Association, which launched a brief strike against the carrier in February.
LaVoy, who led the union in 1991-94, won 60 percent of the votes in a runoff race against Chicago-based Chuck Griffin.
About 70 percent of the union's 9,300 members voted in the run-off race.
Outgoing president Jim Sovich lost his re-election bid in a close first-round vote last month. LaVoy is to take over the post on July 1.

Sovich led the APA in a brief February strike that was stopped within half an hour when President Clinton ordered the pilots back to work and set up a presidential board to help broker a new labor contract.
The airline and union leaders finally reached agreement on a new five-year contract for the pilots in March and it was approved by rank-and-file members in May.
